metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7440 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The C software implementation of AES Encryption and Decryption in wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before 3.9.10 makes it easier for local users to discover AES keys by leveraging cache-bank timing differences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7440` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.53-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
